repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body: I don't think we need the `__Pyx_check_twos_complement()` part in `Common.c` for this. Thus, it might be worth extracting the unsigned checks into a new, separate utility code section and let both existing utility code sections depend on that.
You're right, I've seen this and thought that it probably won't cause any problems, but I'm not sure about it so this seems like a better option
You do not need to spell out empty sections. Just a `.proto` part is fine.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -93,3 +93,20 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE %(type)s %(func_name)s(%(type)s b, %(type)s e) {
     }
     return t;
 }
+
+
+/////////////// IsUnsigned.proto ///////////////
+
+#ifndef __PYX_IS_UNSIGNED
+    #ifdef __cplusplus
+        template <typename T>
+        struct __PYX_IS_UNSIGNED_IMPL {static const bool value = T(0) < T(-1);};
+        #define __PYX_IS_UNSIGNED(type) __PYX_IS_UNSIGNED_IMPL<type>::value
+    #else
+        #define __PYX_IS_UNSIGNED(type) ((((type)-1) > 0))
+    #endif
+#endif
+
+/////////////// IsUnsigned ///////////////
+
+/* Nothing here */

comment_data.body: I think `ModuleSetupCode.c` is a better place for this (`CMath.c` definitely is not), maybe before the `CInitCode` section.

commit.message: Buffer.c: require `Overflow.Common` instead of copying code
Use char buffers so bytearray would be accepted

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).
